page.title: 15Railway: Harwich - The North
page.content: The railway was built about 1860-70. Each day there are 19 trains going south and 19 trains going north.The earliest train is at 00.29 and the last train is at 23.03. Most of the south bound trains go to Harwich,the rest go to Bury St. Edmunds, Ipswich, Stanway, Kent and Colchester. The north bound trains go to Whitemoor, Peterborough, Birmingham and Glasgow. At the level crossing the railway is 2 track. They use orange and red flashing lights and an automatic barrier to stop cars from crossing the line when a train is coming. There are 2 postal trains and 1 parcel train a day. They go to London via Ipswich. There is a special carriage with pigeon holes and the letters are sorted on the train. There are 2 boat trains a day, one from Peterborough and the other from Wolverhampton.
